page.title: 19LANDSCAPE THE CROWPOUND
page.content: About a mile to th west of the village,close to a sign post on the top of Goonzion Downs low banked hedges may be seen enclosing about a quarter of an acre of land .This was the place where St Neot impounded the crows.It appears that St Neot pleaded with the farmers to go to church on Sundays.The farmers' excuse was that if they left the fields the crows would damage the crops.So St Neot considered the matter and then said,"If you go to church on Sundays I shall take care of the crows."So every Sunday St Neot impounded the crows in the Crow Pound.
